reviews.text: Great hotel, lots of good points...
reviews.title: Fab Breakfasts and Staff :)

reviews.text: Pool, jacuzzi, changing rooms - clean & not too busy, long opening hours.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Breakfasts - fantastic selection & quality, efficient staff, warmest buffet food we've had, it's normally so lukewarm, bonus : it's available until 11 am.
reviews.title: Best bed ever!

reviews.text: Reception staff - very polite, helful and efficient.
reviews.title: Improved
Great hotel
reviews.text: Bedrooms- clean, comfy, well equipped.
We stayed at this hotel over the Christmas period whilst visiting family in the area.
reviews.title: Could do better

reviews.text: There were no problems with check-in as previously reviewed and I guess that was just good timing on our part. The room itself was ok; we were on the third floor at the front of the building. The bathroom was in need of a good clean, there was mould in the shower and the toilet wasn’t very clean.
reviews.title: Party

likes.liked: — The good staff were really good.
likes.disliked: — Although understandable, no apology was offered for getting our bill wrong and inconvenience caused

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My biggest complaint about the hotel would have to be about the shower, the pressure was very poor and we could have had a better wash in a shower of rain. We did address this with reception who assured us that the maintenance guy would have a look in to this but no improvements were made. I was reading through the previous reviews and if you are thinking of staying at this hotel ask for a basement room if a good working shower is important to your stay. When we made the booking online we made a request for extra bath towels, this must have been overlooked as we had to call down for these everyday.
reviews.title: Good overnight stop

reviews.text: I will not be staying at this hotel again due to the poor pressure in the shower. Whilst this may seem like a silly reason to not return it is quite important to me to have a fully functioning shower.
reviews.title: Simply Terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In many ways the service was good. The hotel waiting staff coped reasonably with some guests arriving late (M25) and the catering staff were flexible in accommodating unexpected changes to table displays.
reviews.title: The softest bedding.....

reviews.text: We just spent 2 nights here and had an excellent experience. Check in was a breeze, our room was spotless and spacious, We arrived late due to being tied up in London and it was not a problem.The person at the front desk offered to make dinner reservations for us when we inquired about the restaurant's hours. When we arrived in the dining room, we were greeted kindly and throughout our meal the staff was very attentive. The food was excellent. The breakfast in the morning was excellent as well. Chocolate belgian waffles....fantastic! There was at least one function going on while we were there, and other than seeing people arrive as we sat in the lobby, which by the way was also very nice, there was no noise or any other way to tell a party was going on. The only glitch was that due to needing to check out prior to breakfast hours on our second day, we ordered room service to deliver breakfast at 6:00 and when at 6:15 it still had not arrived, we had to call the front desk to inquire about it. It did not arrive until 6:30, making us late checking out, but the person delivering the food waived the tray fee because of the inconvenience. From check in to check out, every person we encountered there was pleasant and helpful and made us feel comfortable and welcome. Next time we are in this area, we will return to the Marriott.
reviews.title: Top Notch Treatment

likes.liked: — The beds and the comfort of the rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had my wedding reception at this hotel and it was perfect! The staff were fantastic and were very considerate. And the hotel itself is just fantastic, especially for the price. The rooms were again perfect. My sister-in-law didn't want to leave her room because the beds were so comfortable. She said usually she suffers from a bad back, especially of a night but she didn't have a problem here at all. The only one thing that bothered me was the price of drinks! It was about £5.20 for a glass of wine. I could get 2 bottles and still have change at my local off licence for this!!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.text: The breakfast again was fantastic as was the swimming pool. I loved it here and wouldn't hesitate to stay again, although I only live down the road so probably wouldn't. But I would definitely recommend this hotel for weddings or parties or just to stay over the night. Excellent!
reviews.title: excellent in every way

likes.liked: — Comfortable & well run hotel in an excellent location.

reviews.text: I chose this hotel purely for its location (playing in the London Stedfast Band!) and stayed for just one night. I found the staff courteous, friendly and knowledgeable. My requests for a high floor, non-smoking room were met without problem and I was able to find a slot in the hotel car-park despite arriving fairly late in the evening. Breakfast was excellent and I thought it was considerate of the management to inform guests via the tv info system that the breakfast room would be very busy on Sunday morning from 0930 onwards. Avoid waiting, eat early! I checked out after breakfast, but did not collect my car until late afternoon. This was no problem & I wasn't charged for parking. If the band plays Bexleyheath next summer, I will certainly stay at the Marriott again.
reviews.title: very nice stay....excellent value

likes.liked: — the pool was great and the breakfast was excellent!

reviews.text: My family and I had a very nice short stay at this hotel. The room was spacious and immaculate. The breakfast was wonderful. I have stayed at several Marriott hotels now and the standard is alwaya high.
reviews.title: Avoid!

reviews.text: I have to admit I wasn't expecting much from this hotel but I was amazed. It is fabulous! The rooms are huge, the service is excellent and the staff are mega polite. The bar was open till midnight and after that there is a large, comfortable lobby to sit around chatting in for as long as you like. Breakfast is great - all types of food. The car parking is £3 but it's worth it as its only a short walk to the hotel from the carpark.
reviews.title: A really excellent hotel

likes.disliked: — the limited vegetarian options on the restaurant menu

reviews.text: I can't recommend this place enough.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel

reviews.text: I booked the hotel based on price, availability and proximity to the Brands Hatch GP circuit for the final round of the A1 GP. Many hotels in the immediate vicinity were full so I was pleased to find availability at the Marriott - only 20mins away from the track. The Marriott is decent hotel with high levels of service. Rooms are a good size, clean and modern with good amenities.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay efficient service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Did not sample the restaurant in the evening, but opted for Bexeley high street - not much on offer apart from chain restaurants you find in most towns / cities.
reviews.title: Really Pleasently Suprised

reviews.text: Bar was pleasant and not over priced as with many hotels.
reviews.title: pleasent weekend

likes.disliked: — check in was a little difficult due to payment card
